name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— Using the correct and complete set of drawings
— All drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Crushed rock mixes proposed for use on specified works shall be registered in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice for Registration of Crushed Rock Mixes RC500.02 as listed in Section 175
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design VicRoads Approval
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material intended for use is to be submitted to the client prior to placement to verify it conforms to required specifications.
1.4 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of joints. Transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to next by not less than 2 metres
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of joints. Longitudinal joints offset from one layer to next by not less than 150mm. Longitudinal joints to be located within 300mm from planned traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A single lot shall be considered a single layer of 4000m2 or one days production in a single layer, whichever is lesser.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP, Delivery Dockets

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The maximum thickness of any pavement base layer shall not exceed 150 mm and the maximum thickness of any subbase layer shall not exceed 200 mm. The minimum thickness of any pavement layer shall be 4 times the nominal size of the material.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No visible deformation or springing in presence of Superintendent's Rep.( Cl 173) Plant to comply with requirements of Cl 173.03.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
3.1 Determine Testing Scale & Initial Testing Frequency

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall initially test every lot for acceptance of compaction in accordance with the requirements of the Specification. Testing of every lot shall continue until three consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified.

○ Scale B - The first lot of each pavement course shall be tested for post-compaction grading and PI. If the first lot each pavement course satisfies the specified post compaction requirements in Clause 304.10(a) and (b), as applicable, no further post compaction testing will be required for that pavement course.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Table 204.161, Cl.304.08 (a), Cl.304.11 (b), Cl.304.11 (c)(i), Table 304.111
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Minimum Characteristic Density Ratio (CDR) of not less than 98%, using Modified compaction effort.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Cl304.08, Table 3040.061, Cl 304.11 (b), Table 304.111
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any lot which has a surface area less than 500 m2 may be treated as a small area. Acceptance of the lot shall be based on the mean values of 3 individual tests. Minimum Compaction shall be 100% modified compaction effort.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records, Lot Register
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Post compaction material grading results must comply with the following:
○ Class 3 - As per Table 304.101 - VR Spec. 304.10
○ Class 2 - As per Table 304.101 - VR Spec. 304.10
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Post compaction PI results must comply with the following:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Test reports
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Layer to be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and after compaction shall conform within the following limits:
○ Shape: no point deviation > 8mm from 3m straight edge in any direction
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Cl 304.06(b, d, i) Drawings, Table 304.062
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off; Survey Report, Lot Markup
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

— All drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material intended for use is to be submitted to the client prior to placement to verify it conforms to required specifications.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast reinforced concrete pipes shall be accepted on the basis of full compliance with the requirements of this section and AS/NZS 4058.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed Receival and Inspection Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast Reinforced Concrete Box Culverts to comply with requirements of VicRoads Section 619.
○ Precast Reinforced Concrete (Portland) Pipes shall comply with requirements of AS 4058
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.619, Cl. 701.04, Cl. 701.05(a), AS4058, AS4680
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Receival & Inspection Checklist, Manufacturer cetificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete shall be manufactured to the concrete mix design registered by VicRoads and comply with the requirements of Section 610.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.610, Cl. 705.04, AS5100
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Receival & Inspection Checklist, Manufacturer cetificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Materials used for bedding and selected backfill shall be free from perishable matter and lumps and shall conform with the requirements of Table 701.091 and Table 701.092.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ordinary backfill shall be free from perishable matter and shall conform with the requirements of Table 701.091.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cementituous grouts shall be minimum Type C class dual shinkage compensating, with a minimum 28 day compressive strength of 40 Mpa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all drainage lines are to be confirmed with the superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance ( between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts. Trench walls to be vertical where practical
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A minimum clearance of 400mm is required around the external faces of precast pits.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm loose thickness. Bedding shall be compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment. Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Delivery dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes & pits placed as shown on the drawings. No laying to occur until bedding lines and levels and compaction requirements have been satisfied
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All interlocking (flush) joint reinforced concrete pipes shall be mortar jointed, or wrapped with a 200 mm wide external joint rubber band.
2.9 Sealing - for joining culvert sections and pipe penetrations in pits

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Contact areas between top and bottom sections of box culverts to be mortared. The joints between various components such as drainage pits, access chambers and pipes shall be made watertight using a cementitious mortar in accordance with the requirements of Clause 610.32.
2.10 Survey of laid pipe or pit

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The location of each run of drainage has been verified prior to backfilling and conforms to the following tolerances: (a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of kerbs or barriers ±20 mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100 mm
(c) invert level of pipes at pits ±50 mm
(d) departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10 mm in 10 m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Height of additional bedding material = 30% of nominal pipe diameter or culvert height.
○ Compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
2.12 Place & compact backfill material over pipes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill under paved area:
○ fill trench with selected back fill material to subgrade level
○ Back fill trench with selected back fill to a level 0.3 m above the top of pipe or culvert, and ordinary back fill above that level
2.13 Place & compact backfill material around pits
○ Compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where approval is given from superintendent, culverts in trenches may be backfilled to half the pipe diameter or box culvert height with 3% stabilised sand with a water content sufficient to ensure penetration beneath the pipe or box culvert invert without leaving free surface water.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval, ITP signed
2.16 Pit base shaped with concrete to match pipe invert
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As shown on Standard VicRoads drawing - Pit & Pipe Invert levels SD 1002
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Standard VicRoads drawing SD 1002
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Covers must be set to within ±10mm of the design levels shown on the drawings
2.18 Repairs to damaged pipes and box culverts
FREQUENCY: Each damaged pipe or culvert
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No repairs shall be undertaken without the superintendents approval of the repair materials and procedures
○ All repair procedures undertaken in accordance with Cl 701.25
3.1 Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
FREQUENCY: at least 20% of all lots
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill material shall be compactied to a mean density ratio of 97% using standard compactive effort.

○ Bedding shall be compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment. Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of earthworks to subgrade level and prior to construction of pavement layers, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All pipes to be flushed clean upon completion
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pit and pipes to be clean suitable for use prior to hand over
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:

— All drawings are the latest revision

RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to the first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural Concrete Design & Submission ITP completed and signed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Teambinder records

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement schedule has been prepared for the reinforcement supply, to ensure that it achieves the specified tolerances on member dimensions, concrete cover and specified locations
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Delivery dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavations shall be to the depths shown on the drawings and that necessary to provide satisfactory foundation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete. Formwork/shoring shall be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures can be inspected, and sufficiently tight at joints to prevent loss of slurry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.1 Excavation/Foundation – Blinding, sealing or foundation concrete

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Blinding, sealing or foundation concrete shall not be placed until the bottom of the excavation has been reviewed by the Superintendent. Inspected and approved by the Superintendent.
○ Hold Point released by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Delivery dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A pre-pour survey carried out to confirm erected formwork within the tolerance. Any errors in the level or positioning of formwork is to be corrected prior to placing concrete
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In lapped splices, the bars shall be placed in contact and the specified cover shall be maintained.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be placed until all foreign material has been completely removed from the forms
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.5 Correct forms, reinforcements, rag bolt assembly and embedments
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Superintendent confirms that the inspected formwork, reinforcement, rag bolt assembly and embedments comply with the project drawings and specifications.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed & Pre-Pour checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement and/or concrete shall not be placed until the proposed method of removing mud, loose rock or similar materials has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be place when temperature is <5°C or > 35°C
○ All steel components that are in contact with the concrete shall be cooled to below 32°C before concrete is placed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling in accordance with 610.16
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Discharge time (concrete placed and compacted) < 90 minutes from batch time unless approved otherwise.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed. Accurate Site Notes & Load Mapping
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be tansported, handled and placed in a manner that will prevent segregation or loss of materials
○ Concrete shall not be moved horizontally by vibrators
○ In continuous pours the max. time lag between truckloads on site is 25 minutes
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sufficient time shall be given for the concrete to cure prior to loading.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall be removed carefully and in such a manner as to avoid damage to the member or the concrete surfaces and maintain safety at all stages of removal. Formwork and formwork supports shall not be disturbed or adjusted during the concreting operation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
5.3 Positional tolerance and dimensions of concrete members and piles
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Dimensions within the tolerances given in Cl 17.5 of AS3600 (-10,+40)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Post Pour Checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete sampled and tested for Compressive Strength, and Slump.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Recorded of as-built drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Lot Maps
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to the first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural Concrete Design & Submission ITP completed and signed.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Teambinder records

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement schedule has been prepared for the reinforcement supply, to ensure that it achieves the specified tolerances on member dimensions, concrete cover and specified locations
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall notify the Superintendent for inspection of the pile excavation by the Superintendent. Prior to inspection, the pile excavation shall be de‑watered and the walls and base of the pile cleaned out, including the internal surface of the casing, to remove all mud, loose or foreign material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Designed and constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete. Formwork/shoring shall be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures can be inspected, and sufficiently tight at joints to prevent loss of slurry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Further to the requirements of clause 611.10 spacers and supports for bored pile steel reinforcement shall be placed at intervals of no more than 2 m along the full length of the steel reinforcement cage to ensure that the specified concrete cover to the steel reinforcement is maintained.
○ Concrete shall be placed through a tremie tube and shall not be dropped from a height greater than 2 m through air.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be placed until all foreign material has been completely removed from the forms
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.2 Correct forms, reinforcements, rag bolt assembly and embedments
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Superintendent confirms that the inspected formwork, reinforcement, rag bolt assembly and embedments comply with the project drawings and specifications.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed & Pre-Pour checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement and/or concrete shall not be placed until the proposed method of removing mud, loose rock or similar materials has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be place when temperature is <5°C or > 35°C
○ All steel components that are in contact with the concrete shall be cooled to below 32°C before concrete is placed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling in accordance with 610.16
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Delivery dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Discharge time (concrete placed and compacted) < 90 minutes from batch time unless approved otherwise. Batch to be used has a discharge time of 180 minutes.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed. Accurate Site Notes & Load Mapping if req.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be tansported, handled and placed in a manner that will prevent segregation or loss of materials
○ In continuous pours the max. time lag between truckloads on site is 25 minutes
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent, temporary casing shall be used to prevent collapse of holes during the excavation operation.
○ Care shall be taken to prevent soil and rock dislodging from the side of the hole and contaminating the concrete forming the minimum cover to the reinforcement.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sufficient time shall be given for the concrete to cure prior to loading.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall be removed carefully and in such a manner as to avoid damage to the member or the concrete surfaces and maintain safety at all stages of removal. Formwork and formwork supports shall not be disturbed or adjusted during the concreting operation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
5.3 Positional tolerance and dimensions of concrete members and piles
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The centre of the pile head shall be in the specified plan position ±75 mm;
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Post Pour Checklist completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete sampled and tested for Compressive Strength:
— 2 cylinders @ 28 days for VPV=13% & Compressive Strength=40MPa
○ Passing Ability of less than or equal to 10mm
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Test reports
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any piling
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No pile construction shall be commenced within 2.5m clear distance of a newly cast pile until the concrete in the pile has attained a strength of 15 MPa.

○ Installation of piles by methods which involve driven temporary casing or result in significant vibration shall not be carried out within the distance 2.5 m to 9.0 m until the concrete in the pile has attained a strength of 15 MPa and set for a minimum of 24 hours.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where necessary, piles shall be tested in accordance with 606.07; integrity testing, static load testing & dynamic testing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Recorded of as-built drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Lot maps
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
